member.name: ID3D12Device3.EnqueueMakeResident
member.summary: Asynchronously makes objects resident for the device.
member.param: Controls whether the objects should be made resident if the application is over its memory budget.
The number of objects in the ppObjects array to make resident for the device.

param.name: ppObjects
param.para: A pointer to a memory block; contains an array of interface pointers for the objects.
Even though most D3D12 objects inherit from , residency changes are only supported on the following:

member.param: A pointer to the fence used to signal when the work is done.
An unsigned 64-bit value signaled to the fence when the work is done.
member.returns: This method returns one of the Direct3D 12 Return Codes.

summary.para: Represents a virtual adapter. This interface extends to support the creation of special-purpose diagnostic heaps in system memory that persist even in the event of a GPU-fault or device-removed scenario.
summary.div: Note This interface, introduced in the Windows 10 Fall Creators Update, is the latest version of the interface. Applications targeting the Windows 10 Fall Creators Update and later should use this interface instead of earlier versions.
